item.description:
Organizer - Peter Grealish @ (508) 254-3413

Located only minutes from the bustle of downtown Boston, the DCR Blue Hills Reservation stretches over 7,000 acres from Quincy to Dedham, Milton to Randolph. Rising above the horizon, Great Blue Hill reaches a height of 635 feet, the highest of the 22 hills in the Blue Hills chain. (http://www.mass.gov/d...)
We will follow the Skyline Trail, which has many fantastic views of the Boston skyline. This one-way hike is considered MODERATE. It will cover about 7.7 miles and according to the AMC it should take an average hiker about 4 hours 15 minutes +/- to complete it.

We will meet at 9:00 AM at the Park & Ride lot on west end of the Skyline Trail in Canton. The parking lot is located on the west side of Blue Hill Avenue/Route 138 about 1/2 mile north of Route I- 93. This is primarily a commuter lot so try and park towards the back of the lot. Since this is where we will end our hike, we will leave a few cars there and make the short drive to the east end of the trail (Shea Skating Rink, Willard St. Quincy, MA) where we will start our hike.

In an effort to coordinate ride sharing please indicate in your RSVP if you are able to give a ride or if you are looking to get one. All RSVPs must be updated by noon of the day before this event. A MAYBE will be changed to a NO at that time so that others have the opportunity to participate. Changes or cancellations will be posted on the calendar by 6:00 PM the night before the event and those members who responded YES or MAYBE will also be notified via email.
Please contact me if you have any questions.
item.how_to_find_us: I drive a gold Honda Accord MA tags 56H S58. Cell 508-254-3413
item.why: Get out and (hopefully) enjoy the views of the Boston skyline.
item.name: Skyline Trail - Friday Morning 4-18
